maml:description.maml:para: Add content to a Configuration Version of a Workspace
Add content to a Configuration Version of a Workspace

maml:Description.maml:para: The base URL for Terraform Enterprise. If not specified, the Terraform Cloud URL will be used.
The TFE configuration version Id.
The Terraform Enterprise API token as a Secure String.
The path to the file or folder to be uploaded.
The TFE configuration version Id.
The path to the file or folder to be uploaded.
The base URL for Terraform Enterprise. If not specified, the Terraform Cloud URL will be used.
The Terraform Enterprise API token as a Secure String.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $TFEBaseURL = "https://app.terraform.io" PS C:\> $Org = "tfe-organization-name" PS C:\> $workspaceName = "workspace-name" PS C:\> $Token = ConvertTo-SecureString -String 'your-api-token' -AsPlainText -Force PS C:\> $Add-TFEContent -TFEBaseURL $TFEBaseURL -ConfigVersionID $config.id -Token $Token -contentPath "C:\terraform\terraform-code-dir\"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Upload the content in the "C:\terraform\terraform-code-dir\" folder to your Terraform Enterprise workspacce.

maml:description.maml:para: Add one or more variables to a workspace
Add one or more variables to a workspace

maml:Description.maml:para: The base URL for Terraform Enterprise. If not specified, the Terraform Cloud URL will be used.
Terraform Enterprise organization name.
The Terraform Enterprise workspace name.
The Terraform Enterprise API token as a Secure String.
Non-sensitive Terraform variables in a hashtable
Sensitive Terraform variables in a hashtable
Non-sensiitve environment variables in a hashtable
Sensitive Envrionment Variables in a hashtable
Sensitive Envrionment Variables in a hashtable
Non-sensiitve environment variables in a hashtable
Terraform Enterprise organization name.
The base URL for Terraform Enterprise. If not specified, the Terraform Cloud URL will be used.
Sensitive Terraform variables in a hashtable
Non-sensitive Terraform variables in a hashtable
The Terraform Enterprise API token as a Secure String.
The Terraform Enterprise workspace name.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------

maml:description.maml:para: Approve (apply) a run
Approve (apply) a run in a Terraform Enterprise workspace

maml:Description.maml:para: The base URL for Terraform Enterprise. If not specified, the Terraform Cloud URL will be used.
The Run ID.
The comment for the queue plan.
The Terraform Enterprise API token as a Secure String.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The Run ID.
The base URL for Terraform Enterprise. If not specified, the Terraform Cloud URL will be used.
The Terraform Enterprise API token as a Secure String.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The comment for the queue plan.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $TFEBaseURL = "https://app.terraform.io" PS C:\> $Token = ConvertTo-SecureString -String 'your-api-token' -AsPlainText -Force PS C:\> Approve-TFERun -TFEBaseURL $TFEBaseURL -RunID $RunId -Token $Token -Confirm:$false -Verbose

dev:remarks.maml:para: Approve (apply) a run in a Terraform Enterprise workspace. The RunID can be retrieved from the output of New-TFERun function.

maml:description.maml:para: Get a Configuration Version for a workspace
Get a Configuration Version for a workspace

maml:Description.maml:para: The base URL for Terraform Enterprise.
The TFE configuration version Id.
The Terraform Enterprise API token as a Secure String.
The TFE configuration version Id.
The base URL for Terraform Enterprise.
The Terraform Enterprise API token as a Secure String.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $TFEBaseURL = "https://app.terraform.io" PS C:\> $Token = ConvertTo-SecureString -String 'your-api-token' -AsPlainText -Force PS C:\> $configVersion = Get-TFEConfigVersion -TFEBaseURL $TFEBaseURL -ConfigVersionID $ConfigVersionID -Token $Token

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get a Configuration Version for a workspace. The ConfigVersionID can be retrieved from the output of New-TFEConfigVersion function.

maml:description.maml:para: Get plan for the run (A plan represents the execution plan of a Run in a Terraform workspace.)
Get plan for the run (A plan represents the execution plan of a Run in a Terraform workspace.)

maml:Description.maml:para: Enter the base URL for Terraform Enterprise. If not specified, the Terraform Cloud URL will be used.
The TFE Run Id.
The Terraform Enterprise API token as a Secure String.
The TFE Run Id.
Enter the base URL for Terraform Enterprise. If not specified, the Terraform Cloud URL will be used.
The Terraform Enterprise API token as a Secure String.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $TFEBaseURL = "https://app.terraform.io" PS C:\> $Token = ConvertTo-SecureString -String 'your-api-token' -AsPlainText -Force PS C:\> $RunDetails = Get-TFERunDetails -TFEBaseURL $TFEBaseURL -RunID $Run.id -Token $Token -WaitForCompletion -stopAtPlanned PS C:\> $Plan = Get-TFEPlan -TFEBaseURL $TFEBaseURL -RunID $Run.id -Token $Token

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get plan for the run (A plan represents the execution plan of a Run in a Terraform workspace.) The RunID can be retrieved from the output of New-TFERun function.

maml:description.maml:para: Download the log from a plan
Download the log from a plan

maml:Description.maml:para: Enter the base URL for Terraform Enterprise. If not specified, the Terraform Cloud URL will be used.
The TFE Plan Id.
The Terraform Enterprise API token as a Secure String.
The TFE Plan Id.
Enter the base URL for Terraform Enterprise. If not specified, the Terraform Cloud URL will be used.
The Terraform Enterprise API token as a Secure String.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $Token = ConvertTo-SecureString -String 'your-api-token' -AsPlainText -Force PS C:\> $Log = Get-TFEPlanLog -TFEBaseURL $TFEBaseURL -PlanId $PlanId -Token $Token PS C:\> Write-Output $Log

dev:remarks.maml:para: Download and display the log from a plan. The PlanId can be retrieved from the Get-TFEPlan function.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve or monitor workspace run details (including status)
Retrieve or monitor workspace run details (including status)

maml:Description.maml:para: Enter the base URL for Terraform Enterprise. If not specified, the Terraform Cloud URL will be used.
The TFE Run Id.
The Terraform Enterprise API token as a Secure String.

When waiting for TFE Run to complete, exit when the status is Planned. This is useful when the Terraform Enterprise workspace is not configured to auto-apply (So the plan will stop at 'Planned' stage).
Wait for the TFE Run to complete.
The TFE Run Id.

When waiting for TFE Run to complete, exit when the status is Planned. This is useful when the Terraform Enterprise workspace is not configured to auto-apply (So the plan will stop at 'Planned' stage).
Enter the base URL for Terraform Enterprise. If not specified, the Terraform Cloud URL will be used.
The Terraform Enterprise API token as a Secure String.
Wait for the TFE Run to complete.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $TFEBaseURL = "https://app.terraform.io" PS C:\> $Token = ConvertTo-SecureString -String 'your-api-token' -AsPlainText -Force PS C:\> Get-TFERunDetails -TFEBaseURL $TFEBaseURL -RunID $RunId -Token $Token -WaitForCompletion -Verbose

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieve or monitor workspace run details (including status). The RunID can be retrieved from the output of New-TFERun function.

Enter the base URL for Terraform Enterprise. If not specified, the Terraform Cloud URL will be used.
The Terraform Enterprise API token as a Secure String.
The workspace name.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $TFEBaseURL = "https://app.terraform.io" PS C:\> $Org = "tfe-organization-name" PS C:\> $workspaceName = "workspace-name" PS C:\> $Token = ConvertTo-SecureString -String 'your-api-token' -AsPlainText -Force PS C:\> $workspace = Get-TFEWorkspace -TFEBaseURL $TFEBaseURL -Org $Org -WorkspaceName $WorkspaceName -Token $Token

command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $TFEBaseURL = "https://app.terraform.io" PS C:\> $Org = "tfe-organization-name" PS C:\> $workspaceName = "workspace-name" PS C:\> $Token = ConvertTo-SecureString -String 'your-api-token' -AsPlainText -Force PS C:\> $destroy = New-TFEDestroyPlan -TFEBaseURL $TFEBaseURL -Org $Org -WorkspaceName $workspaceName -Token $Token -Verbose -confirm:$false

Start a new workspace run (queue plan)

The organization name.
The workspace name.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $TFEBaseURL = "https://app.terraform.io" PS C:\> $Org = "tfe-organization-name" PS C:\> $workspaceName = "workspace-name" PS C:\> $Token = ConvertTo-SecureString -String 'your-api-token' -AsPlainText -Force PS C:\> $Config = New-TFEConfigVersion -TFEBaseURL $TFEBaseURL -Org $Org -WorkspaceName $workspaceName -Token $Token PS C:\> $Add-TFEContent -TFEBaseURL $TFEBaseURL -ConfigVersionID $config.id -Token $Token -contentPath "C:\terraform\terraform-code-dir\" PS C:\> $Run = New-TFERun -TFEBaseURL $TFEBaseURL -Org $Org -WorkspaceName $workspaceName -Token $Token -ConfigVersionID $config.id

dev:remarks.maml:para: Firstly create a new configuration version, then upload content to the workspace. Finally create a new Run (Queue Plan) for the workspace.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new Terraform Enterprise workspace.
Create a new Terraform Enterprise workspace.

maml:Description.maml:para: Enter the base URL for Terraform Enterprise. If not specified, the Terraform Cloud URL will be used.
The organization name.
The workspace name.
The Terraform Enterprise API token as a Secure String.
The description of the workspace.
The Terraform version of the workspace.
The Terraform working Directory of the workspace.
Allow automatically apply changes when a Terraform plan is successful.
Allow destroy plan.
Whether to use remote execution mode. When set to false, the workspace will be used for state storage only.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Allow destroy plan.
Allow automatically apply changes when a Terraform plan is successful.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The organization name.
Enter the base URL for Terraform Enterprise. If not specified, the Terraform Cloud URL will be used.
The Terraform version of the workspace.
The Terraform working Directory of the workspace.
The Terraform Enterprise API token as a Secure String.
Whether to use remote execution mode. When set to false, the workspace will be used for state storage only.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The description of the workspace.
The workspace name.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $TFEBaseURL = "https://app.terraform.io" PS C:\> $Org = "tfe-organization-name" PS C:\> $Token = ConvertTo-SecureString -String 'your-api-token' -AsPlainText -Force PS C:\> $newworkspaceName = 'tao-lab' PS C:\> New-TFEWorkspace Set-TFEWorkspace -TFEBaseURL $TFEBaseURL -Org $Org -WorkspaceName $newworkspaceName -Token $Token -WorkspaceDescription "Tao's lab workspace for TFE API dev work" -TerraformVersion '0.12.28' -AutoApply $false -AllowDestroyPlan $true -Verbose

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $TFEBaseURL = "https://app.terraform.io" PS C:\> $Org = "tfe-organization-name" PS C:\> $workspaceName = "workspace-name" PS C:\> $Token = ConvertTo-SecureString -String 'your-api-token' -AsPlainText -Force PS C:\> Remove-TFEWorkspace -TFEBaseURL $TFEBaseURL -Org $Org -WorkspaceName $workspaceName -Token $Token -confirm:$false -verbose

maml:description.maml:para: Set attributes of a Terraform Enterprise workspace.
Set attributes of a Terraform Enterprise workspace.

maml:Description.maml:para: Enter the base URL for Terraform Enterprise. If not specified, the Terraform Cloud URL will be used.
The organization name.
Whether to use remote execution mode. When set to false, the workspace will be used for state storage only.
The workspace name.
The Terraform Enterprise API token as a Secure String.
The new name of the workspace. This is used to rename the workspace.
The description of the workspace.
The Terraform version of the workspace. This can be used to change the Terraform version that the workspace should use.
The Terraform working Directory of the workspace.
Allow automatically apply changes when a Terraform plan is successful.
Allow destroy plan.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Allow destroy plan.
Allow automatically apply changes when a Terraform plan is successful.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The new name of the workspace. This is used to rename the workspace.
The organization name.
Enter the base URL for Terraform Enterprise. If not specified, the Terraform Cloud URL will be used.
The Terraform version of the workspace. This can be used to change the Terraform version that the workspace should use.
The Terraform working Directory of the workspace.
The Terraform Enterprise API token as a Secure String.
Whether to use remote execution mode. When set to false, the workspace will be used for state storage only.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The description of the workspace.
The workspace name.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: C:\> $TFEBaseURL = "https://app.terraform.io" PS C:\> $Org = "tfe-organization-name" PS C:\> $workspaceName = "workspace-name" PS C:\> $Token = ConvertTo-SecureString -String 'your-api-token' -AsPlainText -Force PS C:\> Set-TFEWorkspace -TFEBaseURL $TFEBaseURL -Org $Org -WorkspaceName $workspaceName -Token $Token -WorkspaceDescription "Tao's test workspace for TFE API dev work" -TerraformVersion '0.12.28' -AutoApply $false -AllowDestroyPlan $true

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set the description, Terraform version of a Terraform workspace. Disable auto-apply for the workspace and allow destroy plan for the workspace.

maml:description.maml:para: Discard a run - It can be used to skip any remaining work on runs that are paused waiting for confirmation or priority. This includes runs in the "pending," "needs confirmation," "policy checked," and "policy override" states.

Discard a run - It can be used to skip any remaining work on runs that are paused waiting for confirmation or priority. This includes runs in the "pending," "needs confirmation," "policy checked," and "policy override" states.

maml:Description.maml:para: Enter the base URL for Terraform Enterprise. If not specified, the Terraform Cloud URL will be used.
The Run ID.
Enter the comment for the queue plan.
The Terraform Enterprise API token as a Secure String.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

Enter the base URL for Terraform Enterprise. If not specified, the Terraform Cloud URL will be used.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $TFEBaseURL = "https://app.terraform.io" PS C:\> $Token = ConvertTo-SecureString -String 'your-api-token' -AsPlainText -Force PS C:\> Stop-TFERun -TFEBaseURL $TFEBaseURL -RunID $RunId -Token $Token

dev:remarks.maml:para: Discard a run - It can be used to skip any remaining work on runs that are paused waiting for confirmation or priority. The RunID can be retrieved from the output of New-TFERun function.
